author: caffinatedmonk
content: readme.md push-subpush-sub is daemon maintains subscriptions pubsubhubbub (push) hubs calls specified commands messages arrive. push is server--serverupdate protocol. 's used notify servers changes other servers. tool aims make receiving push updates secure easy.usagecreate config file run push-sub. here's example config file toreceives updates a youtube channel topic dumps into /tmp/pub.txt:# config.tomladdress="127.0.0.1:17889"basepath="https://hub.ydns.eu/"[subscriptions.youtube_channel]topic="https://www.youtube.com/xml/feeds/videos.xml?channel_id=ucf8wozvgrbzzj4netro3m2a"hub="https://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com"command=["/usr/bin/tee", "/tmp/pub.txt"] more configuration options, check config..now run push-sub wait messages. sure basepath ispublically visible points address. a message arrives, command be executed the message passed it through standard input.info[0000] reading config: ./config.toml info[0000] discovering hub name="youtube_channel"info[0000] discovered hub: https://pubsubhubbub.appspot.com name="youtube_channel"info[0000] registered endpoint="https://hub.ydns.eu/zc8iriuuaobmkaox1zc8nhxjgdj0e6n4ft7tjmayyot3f6zxvupgacl56ismr6rgkhebwrwitnxobtazjyxbkt0ze3k9xtd9q1i" name="youtube_channel"info[0000] listening 127.0.0.1:17889info[0001] subscribing name="youtube_channel"info[0001] subscribed name="youtube_channel"info[0013] received message name="youtube_channel"info[0013] running command args=[/usr/bin/tee /tmp/pub.txt] name="youtube_channel"installing get github.com/0xcaff/sub/push-sub you don't go, check the releases prebuilt binaries.daemonizing (systemd)here is systemd unit file run push-sub a daemon:[unit]description=pubsubhubbub subscriberrequires=network-online.target[service]type=simpleexecstart=/opt/push-sub -config /opt/push-sub.toml[install]wantedby=multi-user.target
